info.heading: Connected
info.subtitle: Software Engineer and Engineering Manager
info.description: In addition to my responsibilities as an engineer, I am a house captain in Connected's house system, I captain the Connected volleyball team and I used to run a recurring remote trivia quiz show. I also help plan engineering guild initiatives and Connected's Labs program, as well as recruiting efforts.

cards.alt: Drum set in front of a brick wall with coloured lights shining at it. The Connected logo is shone on the wall.

info.heading: Flipp
info.subtitle: Junior Software Engineer
info.description: I worked on the Retailer Excellence team as part of the Hosted Platform, which was responsible for creating the flyer framework that lives on retailer websites. Since I had many of the same responsibilities as a full time employee, I also helped with onboarding new engineers and attending recruitment events.

cards.alt: Image of Fan standing in front of a background of repeating maple leaves and the Flipp logo, wearing a Canada flag headpiece.

info.heading: University of Toronto, St. George Campus
info.subtitle: Bachelor of Applied Sciences in Computer Engineering
info.description: During my undergrad, I was involved in many different of student life. I worked at the university as a residence don and in the engineering offices. I helped with engineering outreach and recruitment every year: from general volunteering, to being a panelist at events and being a residence advisor at the Girls Leadership in Engineering Experience weekend. I held leadership positions in various clubs and organizations, from the talent show to orientation week.

cards.alt: A group of graduates in graduation gowns standing on the grass against the background of University College at U of T.

info.heading: Extended reality web portfolio
info.subtitle: A-Frame
info.description: Developed a simple workspace with item interactions for AR/ VR and desktop/ mobile. 3D assets were created using TinkerCAD and Blender.

cards.alt: Looking into the 3D model of a room from one corner, there is a desk with a laptop, monitor and keyboard setup. In the back there is a green couch and a shelf with items.

info.heading: PillPal: an IoT multi-pill dispenser and management tool
info.subtitle: ASP.NET Core, C#, ReactJS
info.description: Developed a consumer focused hardware and software solution to improve medication adherence in the elderly. We were selected for the CNIB Hochhausen Prize for Excellence in Accessible Design in Engineering for People who are Blind or Partially Sighted as well as Certificate of Distinction for Excellence in Design Project.

cards.alt: Four people in matching shirts around a poster board, laptop and pill bottles.

info.heading: Smart Charger @ YHack 2016
info.subtitle: Android, Arduino
info.description: Our team of two worked on creating a hardware controlled Android application that would monitor a phone's battery level to stop charging at a user-selected percentage.

cards.alt: Two students standing behind a laptop with the number 88 in front. Fan is on the right, holding a smartphone.

info.heading: Onboarding script @ Flipp's Internal Hackathon
info.subtitle: BASH
info.description: We compiled commands and setup instructions into a script that allowed the user to quickly set up a Ruby on Rails development environment, which reduced average set up time by 80% (a week).

cards.alt: A jelly donut against a backdrop of a laptop on a desk.

info.heading: Huawei Seeds for the Future, Canadian Delegate
info.description: One of 18 delegates across Canada for an immersive two-week cultural and technical lab program in China to understand the roles of Canada and China in the global ICT market.

cards.alt: A group of students in hotel lobby, in front of a Huawei Seeds for the Future sign. The guys are standing or kneeling, and the girls are sitting on the floor.

info.heading: Keeping active
info.subtitle: Volleyball, Ultimate Frisbee, Dragonboat, Fitness
info.description: I love keeping active, though nowadays, I mostly just lift heavy things and play volleyball (court and beach). I did dragonboat for two years and played intramural volleyball and ultimate frisbee throught high school and university. In fact, in my graduating year, I received the Julie Wilkinson Award for the Engineering Athletics Association for achievement in intramural athletics.

cards.alt: Closeup of a dragonboat with paddlers inside, holding up their paddles at an angle. Fan is wearing sunglasses and sticking her tongue out.
